related.description: It's my fault. I'll admit it. During my eight years in the classroom, I ruined at least two amazing literary works by assigning horrifically dull reading projects. My only hope is that those middle school students, whose enthusiasm I quashed, found another way to become passionate about literature.
related.title: Projects to Engage Middle School Readers

related.description: A number of education trends made their mark in 2013, from massive open online courses to evaluating colleges based on their graduation rates. The underlying forces that drove change this year aren't likely to change anytime soon: declining public funding, changing demographics, advancing technology, and a tough job market.
related.title: 5 Higher-Education Trends for 2014

related.description: With 1:1 computing initiatives occuring in school districts across the country, never before have students had such universal access to information. Pedagogical innovations like "blended learning" and "flipped instruction" are changing the way teachers and students interact and learn.
related.title: Udio: A Technology-Rich Literacy Experience for Students with Reading Disabilities

related.description: As soon as she joined one of my online courses and immediately embraced co-learning, I recognized Michelle Cordy as the kind of fearless learner who makes a great teacher. A teacher can do a great deal to facilitate the conditions from which learning communities emerge - but only the learners can make the real magic happen.
related.title: Hacking The Classroom with Michelle Cordy, aka, "Teacher on an Urgent Quest"

title: Cooper Union Students Perform Leaked Transcript of Trustee Meeting
content:
@freecooperunion

In pure Cooper Union fashion, on Thursday night the students occupying president Jamshed Bharucha's office held a performative reading of the 41-page board of trustee transcript leaked by the Voice that same day. While students played the roles of trustees, president Bharucha's lines were programmed using a computerized text-to-speech tool. Students also recorded excerpts from the show via Vine, which you can check out after the jump.
